main.name: Mickey Kim
main.description: As a emergent technology enthusiast, I am working as an embedded software developer creating software solutions to healthcare challenges.
main.bio: I am a technology enthusiast with a passion for digital health. Previously, I worked in computational biology research focusing on personalized genomics for cancer treatment and have co-authored five papers (one first authorship). I also have extensive experience in education consulting to assist parents and students achieve their education goals through personalized expert assessment. I am currently a software engineer at Entia, creating software solutions for challenges in digital health. In my free time I enjoy making music and traveling.

education.degree: Masters of Science in Computer Science
education.description: Graduated with merit (received distiction on dissertation). Course Highlights: C, Java/OOP Design Principles, Databases (MySQL), Web Technologies, Software Engineering Group Project (C#/Unity). Thesis Project: Development of a Web-Based Application for Clinical Evaluation of Parkinson’s Symptoms in a Residential Environment.
Graduated Magna Cum Laude. Received Calhoun Honors College Award for completion of honors-level curriculum.

work.title: Section Manager
work.description1: - Developed admission strategies to colleges, boarding schools via individual consultations
work.description2: - Guided research projects, volunteer opportunities, and essay and application development
work.description3: - Strategized STEM-focused course planning and extracurricular activities
work.description4: - Mentored Jr. consultants on student strategies

work.title: Lab Manager; Research Technician II
work.description1: - Performed computer modeling of genomic data for personalized cancer treatment
work.description2: - Performed machine learning analyses/visualizations in R for computational bioinformatics
work.description3: - Managed 5-person laboratory through meeting scheduling, ordering, and inventory control
work.description4: - Presented research at talks and conferences

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description1: - Performed biophysics research including experiment setup and computational analysis
work.description2: - Assisted with experiment towards paper on motion of UV-irradiated DNA
work.description3: - Performed statistical image analyses using MatLab
